availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, tobacco broker and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Jane Smith Campbell on November 13, 1849. Father of Daniel S. Campbell, William P. Campbell, and Lilly Campbell. Tobacconist in Louisville in 1850. Tobacco broker in Louisville in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a major from December 1861 to October 1862.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 260. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 5. Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, Kentucky: Madison County Courthouse), Film No.: 000819589. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 281. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894-895.
